attributes.action: All school holidays to be the same
attributes.background: I would like to see all the school holidays to be the same . 2 of my Daughters go to different schools and I also work in one .April this year we all have different holidays. My holidays are as follows . 31/3/2017 -18/4/2017 ,My Daughters are...7/4/2017 -24/4/2017 , my  other Daughters ...12/4/2017
attributes.additional_details: How  can we possibly book a holiday when all 3 schools in the same town are all completely different.

attributes.action: Grant siblings access rights
attributes.background:
The decision about how much contact a sibling can have is controlled by the parents.
There are no legal guidelines and the support available can be costly(see below).
This results in many negative relationships which drives families apart.
attributes.additional_details:
After a family break up, parents have multiple options when it comes to contact, as well as legal guidelines in place to protect the best interest of the child.
Siblings have no legal rights to access. They can use mediation but failing that they can apply for a child contact order through the courts. This costs £215 just to apply! They also require permission to do this from a family court, as well as court fees.
www.gov.uk/looking-after-children-divorce/types-of-court-order

attributes.action: Redefine Children Act 1989 allow both biological mothers & fathers equal rights
attributes.background: Parental Responsibility (PR) as defined in the Children Act 1989 (CA 89) has caused so much misery and in extreme cases death of parents and children, there must be an equal 50/50 responsibilities and authorities in relation to the child and the child’s property for biological parents .

attributes.action: Provide better mental health training and support for NHS staff
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to combat mental health issues in NHS staff, and we believe that more support should be in place for workers who are suffering, to avoid tragedies like the ones we have already seen in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
At least two junior doctors in the last year have committed suicide, and one is currently missing

This is unacceptable. The government must care for NHS staff as those staff so diligently care for the public.

attributes.action: Stop Plans to Close and Franchise 37 Crown Post Office Branches
attributes.background: The Post Office has announced it will close 37 of its Crown Post Office branches and seeking to franchise them into existing retailers. This risks 427 jobs; loss in services, accessibility; as well as having a detrimental effect on local high streets. These community assets must be protected.

attributes.action: Increase  healthcare spending now to a minimum of 10.6% of GDP to save our NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS and Social Care are in crisis.Staff shortages abound; ambulances wait for blocked beds, but people need care at home, and social care is missing because of Government cuts to councils.  Don't let the crisis be a tragedy, raise our spending to the level of other G7s now.
attributes.additional_details: According to the King's Fund 8/6/16 the USA, Sweden,Germany,France,Belgium,Denmark,The Netherlands,Japan,Canada,Austria all spend more % of their GDP than we do. The G7 countries spend an average of 10.6%GDP. The NHS is currently being asked to cut millions of pounds via Sustainability Transformation Strategies at a time when the whole system is in crisis.Our NHS must be protected, it is the one thing which stands for Britain, that all citizens,no matter how poor,have access to free healthcare.

attributes.action:
Michaela's Law
Make it law that all council run parks have CCTV in play areas
attributes.background: My 10 yr old daughter was seriously assaulted by a 45 yr old adult in July 2016.There wasn't CCTV and because of this my daughters attacker got away with it.If there had been CCTV my daughter and family wouldn't have had to go through what we are now.The long term psychological impact is devastating
attributes.additional_details: Please support this so that no other family has to go through what we are going through. Children should be safe guarded and protected in this day an age. All children are entitled to play freely and feel safe at all times.

attributes.action: Increase Carer's Allowance from age 60 to the same rate as the State Pension
attributes.background: Full time carers for disabled adults and sick parents cannot claim tax credits or job seekers allowance and currently receive £62.20 per week.  Carers save the government money in Social Care and residential home fees.  They should receive free prescriptions, bus passes, winter fuel allowance etc.
attributes.additional_details: Many people give up work to care for sick, elderly parents or cannot work as they are full time carers for disabled adult children.  If they are married or in a permanent relationship their partners' pension or salary is taken into account and they cannot claim anything extra in their own right.  They save central and local government vast sums with would otherwise be paid out in social care and residential home fees.  They are invariably the sole carer working 24 hours a day 7 days a week

attributes.action: End the discriminatory frozen overseas UK state pension policy in many countries
attributes.background: British pensioners who retire to over 120 countries, mainly Commonwealth, have their rightful state pension frozen impacting lives of 550,000 yet those retiring to other countries have their pension uprated annually, just as though they never left UK. This is discriminatory and causes huge anguish.
attributes.additional_details: More than 95% of the ‘frozen’ pensioners live in Commonwealth countries.The National Insurance Fund is built up from member contributions, including contributions from those who are now frozen! It would cost less than 1% of the annual pension bill to unfreeze pensions. Pensions frozen Australia, Canada, New Zealand, most Commonwealth Countries, and many others. A reciprocal agreement is not needed before they can unfreeze frozen pensions, a simple stroke of the pen could do it.

attributes.action: Stop parents who maliciously deny the other parent access to their children
attributes.background: There are many examples of one parent who stops the other parent from having access to their own children for no good reason other than their own gain and take no consideration of the best interests of their children as often the children will have a strong relationship with the alienated parent
attributes.additional_details: When this happens there can be a long wait for resolution through mediation and/or courts of months. Before any formal hearings take place, it should be illegal for parents to do this and revision of the children and families act is required to give police greater powers of discretion to enforce equal contact where malicious behaviour is proven. Currently there is no support for alienated parents in the interim period before formal proceedings. This must change and made criminal.

attributes.action: EU citizens rights only protected when British citizens rights protected.
attributes.background:
The British Government is not to protect EU citizens rights who live in the uk until the EU makes reciprocal arrangements to protect British citizens rights living in the EU.

This is a negotiating position and should not be given away. British citizens to be put first in all negotiations.
attributes.additional_details: The house of Lords and remain voters want to protect EU citizens in the UK before any reciprocal arrangement has been made to protect British citizens living in the EU. This weakens the UK negotiating position and can be used against the British government by the EU. This must be prevented.

attributes.action: Make Personal Independence Payment (PIP) claims fairer for adults with Autism.
attributes.background: Those with Autism (ASD) can find verbalising difficulties challenging. When considering PIP, the DWP should more carefully assess those with social and communication difficulties, by discussing more with medical professionals, rather than relying on the opinions of an assessor who briefly met them.
attributes.additional_details: My husband moved over from highest level care and lowest level mobility Disability Living Allowance, to the the new PIP system. He has a number of conditions including ASD and mental health difficulties, yet scored 0 on his PIP claim, and as a direct result became suicidal. Those with ASD can mask difficulties, and behaviours can vary; how can an assessment which takes place in their own home environment, with their trusted person present, be a true representation of their usual daily struggles?

attributes.action: Substantiate or retract the Prime Minister's Brexit White Paper introduction.
attributes.background: The PM claims in her Brexit White Paper introduction that an overwhelming majority of people want the Government to get on with Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: No matter what happens with Brexit, British values cannot be served by a post-truth, alternative-facts approach to Government.  Democracy is undermined when unsubstantiated and unverified statements on the views of the electorate are allowed to influence Government decisions.   Unless the Prime Minister has evidence to support her conclusion on the will of an overwhelming majority of people, her opening statement in the Brexit White Paper must be amended accordingly.

attributes.action: Protect access to state funded benefits and services for humanitarian workers.
attributes.background: Humanitarian workers who serve oversea with registered charities are discriminated against and do not have the same access to publicly funded benefits and services that UK dwelling people do. Their service in the national interest means that they no longer meet presence based qualification criteria.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of their contribution to the national interest certain categories of workers, like military personnel and public servants, have their access to benefits and service protected when living overseas in the line of duty. Thus they are treated by legislation as being physically present in the UK, even when overseas. This protection of rights to access state funded assistance or services, from discretionary or mandatory disqualification, should be extended to humanitarian workers.

attributes.action: Keep tinker lane greenfield and the rest of Nottinghamshire clean from fracking
attributes.background: I am a mother to my 3 year old daughter, a farmer’s daughter and a resident of Bassetlaw. We never want to see any land used for high pressure hydraulic fracking in this area. This company is happy to gain much from this while we all stand to gain nothing.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want my daughter ingesting methane and being exposed to chemicals. We want her to have the best start in life. She is at her most vulnerable stage and for me to be able to protect her we need to stop Igas who want to destroy the land which my family and others make a living from by growing food. Polluting this greenfield land will be catastrophic on a local level and national level. This soil grows carrots, barley, wheat, peas and potatoes on it. We believe clean healthy food is important.

attributes.action: Replace House of Lords with an elected house with advisory functions only.
attributes.background: The newly elected house would consist of a total of 100 representatives holding elections at the same time as a general election.  This would make the second house fully accountable to the electorate.  This would prevent the second house from subverting the will of the UK electorate.

attributes.action: That MPs should debate and vote on an inquiry into the events at Orgreve
attributes.background: they has been a lot of distrust between workers and the police due to the suspicion that the events on 18 June 1984 between police and pickets at a British Steel Corporation plant in Orgreave, South Yorkshire.

attributes.action: Licence the Automotive Repair Sector
attributes.background: With vehicle technology advancing at such a pace repairs to vehicles need to be done at the highest standards and following manufactures guidelines. The scope of repairs is needed to be done by a qualified technician.
attributes.additional_details: Modern vehicles are almost impossible to repair without training and specialist tooling either electrical or mechanical. Making it mandatory to have a licence would enable technicians have sufficient training to ensure vehicles are repaired correctly to workshop repair guides.

attributes.action: Integrate reCAPTCHA so signatures are legitimate rather than bot scripted.
attributes.background: If media agencies are going to quote the numbers of signatories as being indicative of public support then this website needs to do more to ensure that bots can't sign it. Using Google's free reCAPTCHA service would be a simple way of stripping out the vast majority of bots.

attributes.action: Ireland Re-unification Talks
attributes.background: As part of The government's Brexit talks, there should be a discussion about a possible Re-Unification of Ireland. As Northern Ireland will now be our only physical border with the EU, some kind of border controls will have to be implemented, to stop any unrestricted movement across the UK border.
attributes.additional_details: Might I suggest that there is a clause that after a specified period of time (say six years) since we have officially left the EU, the people of both Ireland & Northern Ireland can decide whether they would like their current situation to stay the same, Northern Ireland to reunify with Ireland, or whether The Republic of Ireland would like to rejoin the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Install adequate road lighting on the A249 sittingbourne
attributes.background:
Night time driving is never easy,  and unlit roads are a major hazard to all of us using them at night. 
The A249, sittingbourne is a perfect example of this problem.  Something needs to be done before more accidents happen!!!!
attributes.additional_details: From the m20, onto the A249, past Detling Hill through to keycole roundabout, the lighting at night is ridiculously poor & so dangerous to drivers using this stretch of road at night. There is no street lighting & also no cats eyes on the road, and road markings are very worn and near invisable

attributes.action: Give England and Wales a vote on rejoining the EU If the UK breaks up.
attributes.background: Scotland wants to have another referendum on independence after the material change in circumstances due to exiting the EU and Northern Ireland may follow suit. In which case it would perfectly reasonable too look at the again at the case for leaving the EU in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK breaks up and Northern Ireland and Scotland remain in the EU this would be a significant change in material circumstances and would be a good reason to consider England and Wales place in the EU. The relationship with the EU would be quite different as more citizens of England and Wales would be living in the EU. In this event more citizens of the EU would be living in England and Wales. Also trade would be more with the EU and culturally England and Wales would find itself closer.

attributes.action: I propose a referendum to Ban the Burqa in public to be set into UK law
attributes.background: Due to governments once again not listening to the people who elect them I propose you hold a referendum to ban the burqa in all public spaces.  Let the people decide the fate / destiny of our country rather than politically correct politicians worried about being re-elected.
attributes.additional_details: https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/08/31/majority-public-backs-burka-ban/

attributes.action: Improve funding for mental health treatment for young people in Cornwall
attributes.background: Cornwall is one of the only counties in the UK to have no dedicated mental health treatment centre for people under 18. With the government's promise of £1.4bn of extra funding for mental health, we believe there is an opportunity to tackle this silent crisis. #ThinkPositive and sign the petition.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into the death of Mogous Abay
attributes.background: We the undersigned consider the conduct and investigation in to the death of Mogous Abay as being riddled with inconsistencies and incompetence. We therefore call for a public inquiry into his death.
attributes.additional_details: Since 1990 there has been no serious police investigation into the death of Mogous Abay. The circumstances leading to his death are considered to be suspicious and the handling of the case by the police highlights inconsistencies. The police assumed that Mogous had committed suicide by throwing himself from the fourth floor of his flat in London. Contrary to police reports several witnesses have signed statements insisting that Mogous had come to his death before the event of a fall.

attributes.action: Change the way people are tested for dyslexia in secondary school.
attributes.background: People who are dyslexic are not gaining enought support from school due to the fact that the tests used are not effective enought to provide infomation to state that they are infact dyselxic. Also external testing done by dyslexic specialists are not accepted. We want change.
attributes.additional_details: I was personally tested by a dyslexia specialist however my full dyslexia report stating support, such as extra time, that I needed for exams has now been ignored after doing a simplifide dyslexia test that I did in school. They also did not accept any other external infomation provided from a dyslexia specialist. I feel like my dyslexia report was refused by the school because I was sucsessful in my GCSE exams. I therefore believe that testing within school should be done with a specialist.

attributes.action: Save our NHS and social care
attributes.background: The British people deserve the medical and social care the NHS provide and lately the cuts to both have endangered them . From now on no money will be paid to either the EU or foreign aid until both the NHS and social care are fully funded without raising taxes .
attributes.additional_details: Taxpayers money that is paid out to other countries and the EU while British people suffer the consequences is an absolute disgrace and needs to stop NOW . The time has come to put British people first for once .

attributes.action: Make final UK Brexit deal subject to binding, minimum 10% majority, referendum.
attributes.background: Current Brexit discussions are largely uninformed and confused. There's no reason to think that they will not remain post Article 50 triggering. Lies, half-truths were expounded, later admitted false. EU is UK's biggest market, we need to maintain our relationship and work to reform it from inside.
attributes.additional_details: The EU non-binding referendum in June 2016 gave options to stay in / out. 29m citizens did not vote Leave. The 4% majority: Leave vs Remain actual voters is an iniquitous outcome for the majority of citizens. Many failed to understand Leave implications fully. The issue is highly political and self serving for some individuals. Our EU membership is an economic - trade issue. Key are the Single Market and Customs Union, NOT immigration. Other options exist, but unquantified, thus risky.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to fine Funeral Vehicles.
attributes.background: I have been a Funeral Director for over a decade.You only get one funeral, so it has to be done right. It's an utter disgrace when funeral vehicles are issued parking fines. It makes our job even harder. I believe that ALL funeral vehicles should get the RESPECT they deserve.
attributes.additional_details: I want to ask Parliament to change the law, to make it illegal for local councils or private parking providers to issue parking fines to funeral vehicles.

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free childcare for ALL ages not just 2,3&4 year olds.
attributes.background: As a working parent, who is currently on maternity knowing how to afford nursery fees for when I go back to nursery is a worry! There is free hours but for the older children. Not my 6 month old! 15/30 hours for working families who are on the under £100,000 per year income need a helping hand!
attributes.additional_details: More and more parents, families and single mums or dads struggle with paying rent, mortgages bills and juggle every day life let alone another £156 per week bill For nursey just to be able to go back to work full time, maternity lasts 8/9 months, the 15 hours is only eligible for 2,3&4 years of age! What about the 9-24 months of age babies?

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether it is possible to make a success of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: The Government has repeatedly stated it is determined to "make a success" of Brexit. While 52% of eligible voters may have voted to leave the EU, mere determination to make a success out of Brexit is insufficient. The notion Brexit can be successful is not supported by evidence and must be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Potential consequences include the UK leaving the Single Market and the break-up of the UK (both contrary to pledges made in the Conservative Manifesto); a plunge in the value of sterling (which hit a 168-year low following the referendum); few trading partners (diplomats for India, Canada, the US & Australia have stated they prioritise the EU over the UK); the loss of sovereignty over Gilbratar (a red line for Spain in negotiations); no deal with the EU (the 18-month timeframe is unrealistic).

attributes.action: UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland
attributes.background:
PM Theresa May will be entering into Brexit negotiations with Nicola Sturgeon hanging around her leg like an anchor.
The time has come for the UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland.
attributes.additional_details:
The overwhelming success of the SNP in the 2015 General election.
The ratio of Scottish votes to remain in the EU
The volume of hate and vitriol from our neighbours  in the north
William Wallace
The battle of Bannockburn https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Bannockburn

attributes.action: Identification of Britains highest decorated fighter Ace Mick Mannock V.C DSO MC
attributes.background: This petition requests investigation, exhumation and identification to prove/disprove the remains of "A British Airman Of The First World War" buried in Laventie Cemetery are in fact those of fighter Ace Edward Mick Mannock. Furthermore, a named reinterment befitting of this hero be conducted.
attributes.additional_details: Mannock was the highest decorated fighter Ace of WWI with a VC, DSO 2 Bars, MC and Bar. It is believed after his death the information passed on by the Germans as to his burial site was incorrect as it laid in "No Mans Land". The body of another airman was found in the area behind German lines with no records provided of the Airman name. It is commonly believed that this Airman, buried and cited as "A British Airman Of The First World War" in Lavenite Cemetery is, in fact, Edward "Mick" Mannock

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cages under 80x50cm for hamsters
attributes.background:
Thousands of hamsters are kept in cages not suitable. 
According to a pet shop "a cage sized 30X59cm is the biggest cage & is suitable to keep a hamster in as they don't grow much." Incorrect advice is being given to owners & millions of hamsters are living in cages that are not actually big enough
attributes.additional_details:
This leads to physical issues, chronic stress causing untamed behaviour & sadly, even worse.

The RSPCA's guideline is 80X50cm floor space as a minimum. There are thousands of cages smaller than this being sold every day as "permanent" homes for Syrian Hamsters by uneducated staff.

Cages sold as Large (30x59cm) are too small for permanent residence, the minimum recommended size for an adult Syrian should be 80x50cm. Lets be the voice for those that cant speak & improve the welfare of hamsters.

attributes.action: Standardise the upper age limit to 18yrs for treatment at a Children’s Hospital.
attributes.background: Isabel Gentry died from Meningitis B on 20/5/16 aged 16yrs. The inquest in to her death found that she had received substandard medical care. One issue was  Isabel’s age as it was unclear whether she should go to the Children’s or Adult A & E. Hospital guide lines state 16+years are Adult.
attributes.additional_details: An independent medical expert stated that if Isabel had attended at her hospital in London she would still be alive today. The hospital there accepts children up to the age of 18 years. A teenager’s physiology is different than that of an adult and therefore requires a different level of treatment. The upper age limit for treatment at a Childrens Hospital should be standardised at 18 years.

attributes.action: Exempt homes that people are living in from the definition of "brownfield" land.
attributes.background: The current definition of brownfield land puts your home at risk. Brownfield land used to be thought of as ex-industrial but your home is now considered to be 'brownfield' (land which has been previously developed). The National Planning Policy Framework prioritises brownfield land for development.
attributes.additional_details: As profits to be made out of regeneration increase, this risk extends to more and more occupied homes. Homes are compulsorily purchased and existing tenants evicted so the land can be sold for development. At the moment this is mainly the terrified residents of council estates - because councils own some of the land already, can force out their own tenants & CPO leaseholders & freeholders relatively cheaply. But the brownfield definition means it will be any homes where a profit can be made.

attributes.action: Government to correct errors in the Brexit White Paper
attributes.background: The Brexit White paper contained a number of "Alt Facts".  It is important that matters of such importance are worded correctly and these must be corrected. Some details below but a thorough fact check must be done
attributes.additional_details:
1. 65 million people are not willing this to happen. At best it may be 17.4 million. Accurate figures needed. 
2. The statement "the country is coming together" is  a "nominalisation" in linguistic terms. Please expand as it appears to have been extracted from a song by The Beatles
3. The first statement is negative. It must be more positive e.g. "The negotiations will be a great success". 
4. The 14 week holiday promise must be paid holiday as is implied by the promise but not stated.

attributes.action: Government to introduce fair pay increases for the public sector above 1%.
attributes.background: In 2015 MP's received a pay rise of around £10,000. This was after years of other public sector workers having their pay and increments frozen meaning in real terms they missed out of thousands of pounds. MP's continue to cap public sector rises at 1% yet they are set to receive more than 1%.
attributes.additional_details: MP's are set to receive 1.4% pay rise in April 2017. Yet public sector pay rises have been stuck at 1% for years. This was after pay freezes and increment freezes. MP's can not fall back on the defence of "we don't choose how much of a pay rise we get, this is decided by an independent group". MP's have the power to change this unfair process and give public sector workers the pay they deserve for keeping the country running. With these vital jobs the county would ground to a halt.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd British EU Referendum within 6 months of triggering article 50.
attributes.background: False promise of £350 million going to NHS, hate crime and racism rising by 50%, EU national families in danger of being torn apart, denying our children free movement to share European culture values, Risking rising instability and far right politics in EU, undermining EU as force for global peace
attributes.additional_details: Given the above has happened since 23/06/16, & now the British people have a clearer idea of how damaging Brexit could be to trade, humanitarian rights , tolerance, openess & fairness in an increasingly dangerous divided world, with the chance that UK itself could fracture, we should be given another opportunity to choose our future. Referendums are advisory not mandatory, and the 48% who chose to remain are being silenced. Those who chose to leave can have the chance to review their decision.

attributes.action: Make  sanitary products free for secondary school girls in United Kingdom
attributes.background: The cost of sanity products has gone up and this has put a strain on the already lean purse of most household . Think the sensible thing is to cushion the effect of government cuts social benefits and the rise of income tax

attributes.action: Include all domestic pets to the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.background: The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.
attributes.additional_details: A working animal, usually domesticated, is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks which tends to give them a special status within the law. Today there are a wide range of domestic animals kept in the UK who deserve to be included in the act. For example, today Cats are successfully used as companions for the sick and disabled in care programs. They have served in the agricultural sector and in the military over many years. The Act must be updated to reflect these modern relationships.

attributes.action: Make organisations who do PIP & ESA medicals pay the cost of sucessful appeals
attributes.background:
There are serious concerns about the honesty of medical assessments completed for the purposes of PIP & ESA benefits. 
Dishonest medical assessments have serious negative health consequences for many sick and disabled people, some who decide death/suicide is a better option than the appeal system.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that dishonest claimants need removing from the benefit system however dishonest assessments don't solve this problem. 
If as many claim there is no dishonesty from the medical assessors then getting the organisations to pay for the cost of sucessful appeals should not affect them (DWP still covering the cost of unsucessful ones).
If we are right and false medical assessments are causing a rise in appeals then they should be paid for by those causing them instead of the taxpayer.

attributes.action: Repeal "Fishery Limits Act 1964" regardless of Brexit deal success or failure.
attributes.background: Take back control of British sovereign waters regardless of the success or failure of Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: To resolve the NHS financial crisis divert foreign aid payments into the NHS
attributes.background: Our whole NHS system is at breaking point and needs more investment. The money has to come from somewhere so rather than give foreign aid money to developed countries who are not suffering a humanitarian crisis give the money to the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: If you don't know how bad things are watch the BBC documentary Hospital, try and get to see your GP or go to A&E and see how long you have to wait. Call an ambulance or simply watch the news - IT'S CHRYSTAL CLEAR THE NHS IS IN CRISIS!!

attributes.action: Make government help fund Silverstone Circuit so they can keep hosting F1
attributes.background: Silverstone is the home of Formula One, & motor racing in general. The British Grand Prix NEEDS to be kept at this historic track to help sustain the future of the sport. It's bad enough we, the fans, are unable to watch all races live on free-to-air, so to lose this too would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/formula1/38526002

https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2017/jan/05/future-f1-british-grand-prix-silverstone-in-doubt-hosting-costs

http://www.skysports.com/f1/news/12433/10719351/silverstone-considering-terminating-british-gp-contract

attributes.action: Reverse the mortgage interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords.
attributes.background:
The government will curb the amount of tax landlords can claim back on their property investments, meaning buying and renting out property may no longer be viable for many.
This will result in some landlords who finance their business with mortgages paying tax despite making no profit.
attributes.additional_details:
The policy discriminates against individual buy-to-let investors by denying them the same rights as other business owners.'
In no other business are costs wholly incurred to fund the business liable for taxation.

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: Ensure that a Scottish independence referendum includes all born & bred Scots
attributes.background: In the 2014 Scottish independence referendum born & bred Scots, residing outside the country, were denied the right to vote in the referendum. This must not be allowed to be the case if there is a 2nd referendum.  Scotland's future must be decided by all Scots, no matter their location in the World.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to ESA
attributes.background: The government has repeatedly targeted the sick and disabled with their "austerity" policies. Last year they planned to slash ESA by nearly £30 a week, making it the same as Jobseekers allowance. This was followed by Ian Duncan Smiths resignation, but they are now pushing forward with these cuts.
attributes.additional_details: The government thinks that disabled people looking for or working towards paid employment are simply lazy and slashing their benefits will push them into work. In reality there are many barriers to work for the sick and disabled and slashing benefits does nothing to remove these barriers.  Living with a disability costs and estimated £500 extra a month, these cuts will directly affect the health and wellbeing of those affected, meaning they are less able to find paid employment.

attributes.action: Establish an independent department to ensure truthful politics
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaigning world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to them, we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new independent department should consist of teams from Ofcom,Advertising Agency,CPS,ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.
